Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that all animals currently in the shelter will be euthanized if they are not adopted. (evidence: "Over 900 animals will be put down by September 30th.", "They Will Be Euthanizing All Animals Without A Home!!!", "What isn't adopted out will be put to sleep")
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the statement that all animals will be euthanized. (evidence: "The shelter is not publicizing this very well", "The Germiston SPCA is closing down due to a lack of funds")
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the shelter will euthanize all animals if they are not adopted, without considering other options or possibilities. (evidence: "ALL DOGS MUST BE ADOPTED OR THEY WILL BE EUTHANIZED", "those animals will, sadly, have to be put down")
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanations being presented in the claim.
